reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to complain when you get your room for free with points and we were "upgraded" to a room with a view of the beach, but there's little else to commend this hotel. The room was not much bigger than a cabana and the bathroom was also small. The executive lounge was nice and we enjoyed having breakfast there. The concierge was helpful and did give us a good recommendation for the Thai restaurant, Sawasdee, in Leblon when we said we were tired of barbecue. I understand that the prices at this hotel are quite high and I would not have been happy if we were paying full freight.
reviews.title: Copa Cabana

reviews.text: Great location, great gym and pool. Rooms are nice but not very spacious, Can't understand why most of the rooms have an internal view. You will only get a view if you stay in one of the beach front ones, which are more expensive.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but expensive

reviews.text: Service is good as well as the breakfast. Reccomend this hotel if you are willing to pay the price. Overall you will not find a cheap hotel in Rio.
reviews.title: Best Choice in Center of Copacabana Beach, but get a room with a view!

reviews.text: The JW Marriott is located in the center of Copacabana Beach, so if you are looking for a property on Copacabana, this is about the best choice. I have always stayed at the Othon Palace a few blocks down and decided t try the JW Marriott,
reviews.title: Marriott what are you doing with your brand?

reviews.text: If you are in a city with a beach as beautiful as Copacabana, you have to get a room with an ocean view. I was in an Atrium room for the first two nights and switched to an ocean view the last two nights. Quite frankly the both rooms I experienced are a bit of a disappointment, they are small and the windows are tiny! Why anyone would design a hotel in such a magnificent location and then skimp on window size is simply beyond me. The Othon Palace for example has wonderful balconies and floor to ceiling sliding doors. I was expecting much more of JW Marriott. The Atrium rooms are dark. Two thirds of the rooms are Atrium rooms. They have limited numbers of rooms facing the ocean and of course they attract a healthy premium. Nice bathrooms with good amenities.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, AMAZING ROOF TOP POOL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel with points & had a room upgrade & lounge access due to my Gold Status at Marriott -- that being said - this would have been a HUGE disappointment if I had paid the $400/night price on hotels.com
reviews.title: Not 5 Star

reviews.text: While the gym & lounge have AMAZING views - that's where my praise stops. I could hear my neighbors speaking late into the night due to the thin walls & the drapes didn't drown out all of the morning light - so sleep quality compared to typical Marriotts was poor.
reviews.title: Best Hotel on the Beach

reviews.text: The room was small (even with the upgrade) & the hotel is old - for work this wouldn't be bad, but for a holiday I would rather rent a hotel in Ipanema or stay at the Copacabana Palace. It didn't give me a relaxing vacation feeling.
reviews.title: Best business hotel in Rio

reviews.text: The JW Marriott is located across from the Copa Cabana Beach,. The hotel is beautiful, they have a roof top pool and bar. They also provide beach chairs and umbrellas at no charge on the beach. They have a wonderful executive lounge that serves a bountiful breakfast tasty evening items. They also provide free wine and a special Brazilian drink.
reviews.title: Copacabana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was wonderful and couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were very nice, we had an ocean front one. They are however small, no more than 2 people can occupy the room. The place was clean and very comfortable. They also have a couple of great restauratns in the hotel along with a great little bar.
reviews.title: Beach front room isn't necessary

reviews.text: Overpriced is an understatement:
reviews.title: Little value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very, very small, the bathroom barely fits one person, and many rooms don't even have a view. In general, the hotel looks tired....
reviews.title: Not easy to appreciate the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's just not worth $600 a night. We traveled with a kid and that was a mistake, the entrance to the room is very narrow, there is no space for an extra bed, it's noisy, there is no recreation center and the pool is tiny.
reviews.title: Expensive dungeon

reviews.text: On the good side, the staff is friendly, the bed is comfortable, the location is central, and breakfast is decent but even the coffee is average.
reviews.title: Very small room, great view ...if you get it

reviews.text: Chose Marriott for the view but would look furthe as the great view from a small room was visable only when you were standing by the smallish window as all the chairs in the room put you below eyelevel to look out at the beach. hoping to be able to lie in bed and see the scene. The service was quite good and the included breakfast was very good. Never used the pool but the walk by didn't look very inviting. It is conveniently located but so are many other hotels with better access to the views.
reviews.title: Basic yet Nice

reviews.text: I stayed at this Marriott for 3 days in April, and given my other trustworthy Tripadvisor reviewers, assumed it was going to be a pretty decent place. Unfortunately, it lacks nearly everything except for its great location in the heart of Copacabana Beach. From a location standpoint, it really is smack in the middle (slightly western middle) of the 4km stretch of beach.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing Marriott, with so much Potential

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And that is all it has going for it. Poor service, terrible food, and even the rooftop pool bar is a joke. I arrived early in the AM (around 11am), and while I was told they would do their best to have a room ready, I didn't get one until 1pm. I perfectly understand how hotels work and was not slighted the least by this. So I waited up top at the rooftop pool where I was told I could order lunch from the bar. The "bar" is literally a tiny table-sized area w/ a few drinks basking in the hot sun with no one attending to the bar. I went back downstairs and asked for someone to come up to take my order or if I could just order there. They told me someone would be up any minute. Thirty minutes later, someone came up who barely spoke English and took my pizza order. It took 1 hour for the pizza to arrive!! And alas, it was an awful one at that.
reviews.title: Tight/cramped

reviews.text: The gym at the top area is relatively small w/ old machinery. The pool is adequate, and the view is impressive from the top floor.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The rooms are tiny! I paid nearly double the going rate for a deluxe ocean view room, and the room must have been 200sq ft w/ a tiny window for a view. Do NOT pay double for the nicer room, it just isn't worth it (see my other review on the Porto Bay Rio Internacional a few blocks away that is a superb hotel!). On top of the tiny room, there is no wireless internet (only in the lobby). Given that most new laptops do not even have an ethernet cord, nor do iPads or other Tablets, it's amazing how in 2012, a modern/international hotel does not even have wireless internet in the rooms. And to use it in the lobby, it's $40/day.
reviews.title: Not up to normal JW Marriott standards

reviews.text: The lobby coffee bar was a disaster. The man working didn't seem to comprehend service and moved as slowly as anything service oriented person in Rio. They also had a small offering of food and the coffee was barely lukewarm.
reviews.title: Disappointed in the JW Marriott
